question.text: With reference to factors affecting the rate of photosynthesis, which of the following statements is not correct?

options.text: Light saturation for <math><mi>C</mi><msub><mrow><mi>O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></math> fixation occurs at 10% of full sunlight

Increasing atmospheric <math><mi>C</mi><msub><mrow><mi>O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></math> concentration up to 0.05% can enhance <math><mi>C</mi><msub><mrow><mi>O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></math> fixation rate

<math><msub><mrow><mi>C</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></math> plants respond to higher temperatures with enhanced photosynthesis, while <math><msub><mrow><mi>C</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></math> plants have a much lower temperature optimum
Tomato is a greenhouse crop that can be grown in <math><mi>C</mi><msub><mrow><mi>O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></math> - enriched atmosphere for a higher yield

solution.text: In <math><msub><mrow><mi>C</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></math> plants, photosynthesis is decreased at higher temperatures due to increased photorespiration. <math><msub><mrow><mi>C</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></math> Plants have a higher temperature optimum because of the presence of pyruvate phosphate dikinase enzyme, which is sensitive to low temperature.
